results.title: Soccer
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Crawford Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Man and His Sport”.
Looks at soccer in Australia, concentrating mainly on the coaching of young players to learn the game. Also shows Australia’s international team in action.

results.title: The Athletes [Greek version]
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Man and His Sport”.
The growth of track and field competition in AUstralia is studied, junior events as well as international competitions. We see the work being done to encourage youngsters to participate in track and field events. The film contains some excellent slow motion sequences of athletes performing at their peak, which evoke a strange sort of fluid beauty in this otherwise rather harsh world of sweat and strain. Narration is in the Greek language.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Murray, Frank Bagnall and Film Australia

results.title: Lacock
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place in the Country”.
Part of a series of films made in co-operation with the National Trust, this episode looks at Lacock through the eyes of the family who has lived there.

results.title: Stourhead
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Place in the Country”
Stourhead is the home of the Hoare banking family. The building is classified by the National Trust and this film examines its history.

results.title: Just for dad
results.brief_description: My Dad means a lot to me. He works in Western Australia now, so I don’t get to see him as much as I used to. This story is a tribute to my Dad.

group_siblings.title: Another tide: a Green Corps story
Flying foxes, scrub turkeys and lots of ticks

results.title: Home
results.brief_description: As a child home was just an illusion. Growing up, moving overseas, home became temperal and Australia became “just back home” and on returning home, nothing made sense - everything had changed. Perhaps my mother’s words that “home is where the heart is” says it all.

results.title: This one's for you mate
results.brief_description: We have been through a lot together - good times, hard times - but no-one could ever replace you. A dedication to my best mate.

results.title: Flying foxes, scrub turkeys and lots of ticks
results.brief_description: The contrast from the wide open spaces of WA to the tropical rainforests of NSW proved to be a challenging experience for Gemma when she joined up with the Green Corps team for the adventure of her life.
